definition: Never giving up, even when things get tough
example: Tom Brady showed incredible perseverance when he came back from 28-3 in the Super Bowl.

definition: Holding on tight and never letting go of your goals
example: Like Spider-Man's grip, Steph Curry is tenacious when he keeps shooting even after missing.

definition: Bouncing back quickly after something bad happens
example: The Eagles were resilient after losing their quarterback - they kept fighting and won anyway.

definition: Doing the right thing even when nobody's watching
example: Captain America shows integrity by always telling the truth and keeping his promises.

definition: Starting something without being asked or told
example: Patrick Mahomes took initiative by creating new plays when the coach's plan wasn't working.

definition: Taking responsibility for your actions and mistakes
example: LeBron James shows accountability when he says 'That loss was on me' after a bad game.

definition: Making quick, confident decisions without hesitating
example: A quarterback must be decisive - throw the ball or run, but don't stand there thinking!

definition: Working together as a team to reach a goal
example: The Avengers collaborate to defeat Thanos - they're stronger together than alone.

definition: Speaking clearly so everyone understands exactly what you mean
example: Peyton Manning was articulate when calling plays - every player knew exactly what to do.

definition: Having a smart plan to win or succeed
example: Bill Belichick is strategic - he studies opponents for weeks to find their weaknesses.

definition: Understanding how someone else feels
example: Spider-Man shows empathy by helping the villain when he realizes he's just scared and hurt.

definition: Doing what you need to do, even when you don't feel like it
example: Kobe Bryant had discipline - practicing at 4 AM every day, even on holidays.

definition: Not bragging about yourself, even when you're awesome
example: Giannis stays humble - he thanks his teammates after winning MVP instead of boasting.

definition: Being brave and doing scary things when it's important
example: Jackie Robinson was courageous when he became the first Black player in Major League Baseball.

definition: Working out a deal where everyone gets something they want
example: Iron Man negotiated with Nick Fury - he'd join the Avengers if he could keep his suits.

definition: Staying calm and in control when things get crazy
example: Joe Burrow keeps his composure in the pocket even with 300-pound defenders charging at him.

definition: Having big dreams and working hard to reach them
example: Michael Jordan was ambitious - he wanted to be the greatest player ever, not just good.

definition: Paying attention to every tiny detail to make something perfect
example: Batman is meticulous when planning - he thinks of everything that could go wrong.

definition: Changing your plan quickly when things don't go as expected
example: Lamar Jackson is adaptable - if passing doesn't work, he switches to running.

definition: Believing good things will happen and looking on the bright side
example: Ted Lasso stays optimistic even when his team loses - 'We'll get them next time!'

definition: Standing up for what's right, even when powerful people disagree
example: Luke Skywalker was defiant when he refused to join the Dark Side, even facing the Emperor.

definition: Thinking about how your actions affect other people
example: Aaron Judge is considerate - he signs autographs for kids even when he's tired.

definition: Coming up with new, creative ways to solve problems
example: Stephen Curry was innovative when he started shooting three-pointers from the logo.

definition: Never stopping or slowing down until you succeed
example: The Terminator is relentless - he keeps coming no matter what you throw at him.

definition: Being good at many different things, not just one
example: LeBron James is versatile - he can play any position and do it all: score, pass, defend.

definition: Working carefully and steadily without giving up
example: Jerry Rice was diligent - running the same routes 1000 times until they were perfect.

definition: Being your true self instead of pretending to be someone else
example: Kevin Hart is authentic - he makes jokes about his real life instead of faking being cool.

definition: Showing great bravery, especially in a tough fight
example: Thor made a valiant effort against Thanos, fighting even when he was outnumbered.

definition: Making smart, careful decisions by thinking ahead
example: Andy Reid is prudent with timeouts - he saves them for when the team really needs them.

definition: The quality of never giving up, like a bulldog with a bone
example: Russell Wilson shows tenacity by escaping five tackles and still throwing a touchdown.

definition: Very deep and meaningful, making people think
example: Yoda says profound things like 'Do or do not, there is no try' that teach important lessons.

definition: Speaking in a beautiful, powerful way that moves people
example: Martin Luther King Jr. was eloquent - his speeches made millions want to change the world.

definition: Standing up for yourself confidently without being mean
example: Hermione is assertive when she tells Ron and Harry they need to study - firm but friendly.

definition: Following a careful step-by-step plan to get things done right
example: Nick Saban is methodical - he has a specific process for everything the team does.

definition: So good that others should copy you
example: Tim Duncan had exemplary sportsmanship - he never trash-talked or showed off.

definition: Brilliantly clever and creative in solving problems
example: Tony Stark's ingenious mind created the Iron Man suit in a cave with scraps.

definition: Being very careful to do things correctly and thoroughly
example: Kawhi Leonard is conscientious about defense - he studies every opponent's moves.

definition: Having a special charm that makes people want to follow you
example: The Rock is charismatic - everyone loves him whether he's wrestling or acting.

definition: Breaking down problems into pieces to understand them better
example: CP3 is analytical - he studies game film to find patterns in the defense.

definition: Impressively powerful and a bit scary to face
example: Darth Vader is a formidable opponent - his power makes enemies think twice.

definition: Dealing with problems in a practical, realistic way
example: Coach Pop is pragmatic - if something doesn't work, he changes it immediately.

definition: Speaking up to support someone or something important
example: LeBron advocates for education by building schools for kids who need help.

definition: Growing and developing something carefully over time
example: Steph Curry cultivated his shooting skills by taking 500 shots every practice.

definition: Done on purpose with careful thought
example: Every move Magnus Carlsen makes in chess is deliberate - nothing is random.

definition: Absolutely determined and unwavering in your decision
example: Frodo was resolute about destroying the ring, no matter how hard the journey.

definition: Understanding something instantly without needing to think about it
example: Wayne Gretzky's intuitive play let him know where the puck would be before it got there.

definition: So interesting or convincing that people have to pay attention
example: Coach Carter gave a compelling speech that made his players want to be better students.

definition: Saying a lot with just a few words, no wasted talk
example: Belichick's concise answer was just 'We're on to Cincinnati' - short but clear.

definition: Acting with class and self-respect, keeping your head high
example: Black Panther remains dignified even when challenged - he never loses his cool.

definition: Getting things done quickly without wasting time or energy
example: The Patriots' offense is efficient - they score in 2 minutes what others need 5 for.

definition: The basic, most important part that everything else builds on
example: Dribbling is fundamental in basketball - you can't play without it.

definition: Being kind and polite, especially when winning or losing
example: Roger Federer is gracious in defeat - he always congratulates his opponent.

definition: Deserving respect because you always do the right thing
example: Samurai warriors follow an honorable code - they never break their word.

definition: Being fair to everyone, not picking favorites
example: A good referee is impartial - calling fouls the same way for both teams.

definition: Using good judgment and being wise in decisions
example: Dumbledore makes judicious choices about when to use his powerful magic.

definition: Sharp, eager, and very interested in something
example: Sherlock Holmes has a keen eye for details others miss completely.

definition: Crystal clear and easy to understand
example: Einstein could give lucid explanations of complex physics that kids could understand.

definition: Being generous and forgiving, especially to someone you beat
example: Muhammad Ali was magnanimous - helping opponents up after knocking them down.

definition: Important enough that people notice and remember
example: Simone Biles' notable achievements include moves named after her.

definition: Looking at facts without letting feelings get in the way
example: Scouts must be objective - picking the best player even if they don't like them.

definition: Quickly noticing and understanding things others might miss
example: Rondo is perceptive - he sees passing lanes that open for just a second.

definition: The perfect example of something
example: Michael Jordan is the quintessential basketball player - everything you'd want.

definition: Making decisions based on logic and reason, not emotions
example: Spock makes rational choices using logic, even in dangerous situations.

definition: Smart and experienced in practical ways
example: Veteran players are savvy - they know all the tricks to draw fouls.

definition: Careful about what you say to avoid hurting feelings
example: Good captains are tactful - correcting teammates without embarrassing them.

definition: Everyone agrees completely with no one opposed
example: The unanimous MVP vote meant every single person picked the same player.

definition: Full of energy and enthusiasm
example: Russell Westbrook plays with vigorous intensity every single minute.

definition: Deep understanding that comes from experience and good judgment
example: Uncle Iroh shares wisdom with Zuko about life being more than just winning.

definition: Extremely passionate and enthusiastic about something
example: Kobe was zealous about basketball - it was his entire life.

definition: Very clever at noticing and understanding things
example: Warren Buffett is astute - he sees which companies will succeed before others do.

definition: Kind and wanting to help others
example: Superman is benevolent - using his powers to help people, not rule them.

definition: Honest and straightforward, telling it like it is
example: Charles Barkley is candid on TV - he says what he thinks without sugarcoating.

definition: Skillful with your hands or body movements
example: Kyrie Irving is dexterous with the ball - his handles are like magic.

definition: Serious and sincere about what you're doing
example: Peter Parker is earnest about being Spider-Man - he truly wants to help.

definition: Mental strength to face difficulty with courage
example: Frodo showed fortitude carrying the ring to Mordor despite the pain.

definition: Friendly and enjoying being around other people
example: Magic Johnson was gregarious - always smiling and making teammates laugh.

definition: Working together peacefully without conflict
example: The Warriors had harmonious team chemistry - everyone knew their role.

definition: Perfect with absolutely no mistakes
example: Federer's backhand technique is impeccable - textbook perfect every time.

definition: Extremely happy and celebrating
example: The team was jubilant after winning the championship in overtime.

definition: Full of movement and energy
example: Ja Morant's kinetic style means he's always moving, jumping, and attacking.

definition: Real, valid, and following the rules
example: That was a legitimate win - no luck, just pure skill.

definition: Deserving praise for being excellent
example: His meritorious performance earned him Player of the Game honors.

definition: Quick and light in movement
example: Barry Sanders was nimble - dodging tackles like he was dancing.

definition: The best or most favorable
example: The optimal play was to take a three-pointer with 2 seconds left.

definition: Extremely important for what happens next
example: Ray Allen's pivotal three-pointer saved the Heat's championship hopes.

definition: Good at finding ways to solve problems with what you have
example: MacGyver is resourceful - he can escape using just a paperclip and gum.

definition: Large, important, and significant
example: He made a substantial improvement - going from 10 points to 25 per game.

definition: Celebrating a great victory
example: The triumphant team carried their coach on their shoulders after the win.

definition: Steady and never changing or doubting
example: His unwavering confidence meant he always took the last shot.

definition: Full of life and energy
example: The vivacious crowd energized the team for a comeback.

definition: With complete sincerity and commitment
example: He gave wholehearted effort - leaving everything on the field.

definition: Willing to give way or compromise when needed
example: Sometimes being yielding and letting teammates shine makes the team stronger.

definition: Full of energy and enthusiasm for life
example: His zestful attitude made even tough practices fun for everyone.

definition: Very skilled at something
example: Messi is adept at dribbling through five defenders without losing the ball.

definition: Clear and logical, making sense
example: A good game plan is coherent - every player understands how their role fits together.

definition: Careful and persistent hard work
example: Tiger Woods' diligence in practice made him the best golfer in the world.

definition: To be a perfect example of something
example: Derek Jeter exemplified what it means to be a Yankees captain.

definition: To grow strong and successful
example: Young players flourish under great coaches who believe in them.

definition: Being thankful for what you have
example: Giannis shows gratitude by remembering where he came from and helping others.

definition: Famous and respected for great achievements
example: Michael Jordan had an illustrious career with six championships and five MVPs.
